antiPatterns.name: Transactional Integration
antiPatterns.description: Transactions extend across service boundaries and are not isolated inside services.
antiPatterns.consequences: The three main consequences being performance problem, security threats and rigidity.
antiPatterns.cause: Business processes are not static and if you start designing the SOA completely upfront without keeping some of the lanes open.
antiPatterns.solution: Using the Orchestration, Saga or Inversion of Communications pattern.
sources: @book{rotem2012soa,title={SOA patterns}, author={Rotem-Gal-Oz, Arnon and Bruno, Eric and Dahan, Udi}, year={2012}, publisher={Manning}}
